comments:
From WinXP, using Simulator, w/o OpenRTE (Greg says this is probably not
platform-specific...)

1. Create Simulation Project via Window, Preferences, Parallel Development,
Simulation.
   Under "Simulation Project Settings:" Select Simulation Project Settings:  C 
and hit the "Create" Button.
   Project "PTPSimulation" is created and built.
2. Make a launch configuration, under "Parallel Development" select "PTPSimulation."
	 Browse to find the PTPSimulation.exe that it built for you. (Mine was under
'Debug' dir.)
   On the "Parallel" tab, leave Number of processes = 0.
   Run.
I get the following error in Dev. workbench console:

getProcsForNewJob:job1 - #procs = 0
------------ machine run - job job1
------------ job run: job1
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
	at
org.eclipse.ptp.launch.internal.ParallelLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch(ParallelLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:212)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:590)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:515)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:733)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$5.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:810)
	at
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

If you set number of processes to something >0, this problem does not occur.

I changed the launch configuration which does not allow running 0 process.  In
your case, the "debug" button in launch diglog should be disabled.

I get another version of this error.  As soon as I click on 'Create' on the
preferences page (after selecting 'C') I get:
"Cannot create project"
"Reason:"
"  Internal error"
Details ->
java.lang.NullPointerException

Since I have no idea what a simulation project type is, I'm going to assign this
to Clement.
The simulator is only for UI testing by developers. If this problem occurs again, please reopen.
